text: Joshua P. Entrop. Author, maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {entjosR: Joshua Entrop's User Functions},   author = {Joshua P. Entrop},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://entjos.github.io/entjosR/},   url = {https://github.com/entjos/entjosR}, }

title: Joshua Entrop's User Functions
text: package functions commonly use everyday workflow. likely expand throughout time.

title: Joshua Entrop's User Functions
text: installing package GitHub please use

title: Joshua Entrop's User Functions
text: find bugs suggestion please don’t hesitate file issue GitHub.

title: Simpel matching — cc_match
text: Flexible fast matching functions.

title: Simpel matching — cc_match
code: cc_match(   data,   case_indicator,   id,   matching_factors,   no_controls,   replace = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Simpel matching — cc_match
text: data data.frame including cases potential controls. case_indicator Name variable indicates observation case controls, codes 1 case 0 control. id Name variable identifies unique observations. matching_factors list matching factors accompanying matching criteria either supplied function 'exact', exact matching requested specific variable. matching function take two arguments input first argument value case second argument value control. function function(x,y) abs(x - y) < 1 can example used match cases compactors maximal age difference one year. function function(x,y) y >= x can used concurrent matching, .e., requiering control alive time matching. Example:   no_controls number controls matched case. replace Logical indicator sampling controls done without replacement. Default: FALSE. seed Optional seed used matching. Usefull reproducibility. verbose Logical indicator default checks printed. Default: TRUE.
code: list(sex  = 'exact',      age  = function(x,y) abs(x - y) < 1,      time = function(x,y) y >= x)

title: Simpel matching — cc_match
text: dataset matched cases controls. id Individuals unique id case Case indicator riskset Riskset number/identifier variables included supplied dataset also returned.

title: Simpel matching — cc_match
text: function returns warning number available controls smaller number controls requested case. case availabe controls matched case. matched availabe particular case, case removed output dataset warning shown indicating id case removed. want match exact variable, please use 'exact' indicator shown . improve computation time.

title: Simpel matching — cc_match

title: Get best fitting FPM — fpm_get_best_fit
text: Search model lowest AIC BIC given output fpm_test_dfs call.

title: Get best fitting FPM — fpm_get_best_fit
text: x data.frame AIC BIC criteria different FPMs obtained fpm_test_dfs list thereof.

title: Get best fitting FPM — fpm_get_best_fit
text: data.frame first row corresponds model lowest AIC second row model lowest BIC.

title: Get best fitting FPM — fpm_get_best_fit
code: require(rstpm2)  data(brcancer)  test_model <- fpm_test_dfs(Surv(rectime, censrec) ~ hormon + x1,                  dfs_bh  = 1:5,                  dfs_tvc = list(hormon = 1:3,                                 x1     = 1:5),                  same_dfs_tvc = TRUE,                  data = rstpm2::brcancer)  fpm_get_best_fit(test_model) #>   df_bh df_tvc_hormon df_tvc_x1      aic      bic #> 4     4             1         1 5224.228 5265.006 #> 2     2             1         1 5225.531 5257.247

title: Tests DFs for FPMs — fpm_test_dfs
text: Test degrees freedom (DFs) Flexible Parametric Survival Models (FPMs).

title: Tests DFs for FPMs — fpm_test_dfs
code: fpm_test_dfs(   formula,   dfs_bh = 0,   dfs_tvc = NULL,   by_vars = NULL,   same_dfs_tvc = FALSE,   data )

title: Tests DFs for FPMs — fpm_test_dfs
text: formula R-formula passed stpm2 call. dfs_bh vector DFs tested baseline hazard function. dfs_tvc list variables vector DFs tested time varying effects, e.g. list(case = 1:10, female = 1:3). by_vars character vector factor variable names used fit stratified FPMs. One FPM fitted combination factor levels specified. especially useful, testing stratified FPMs. same_dfs_tvc TRUE combinations DFs different tvc variables tested. Instead DFs minimum DF specified largest specified DF dfs_tvc tested variables specified dfs_tvc time. data data set used fit FPM.

title: Tests DFs for FPMs — fpm_test_dfs
text: data.frame one row per combination baseline hazards tvc dfs corresponding AIC BIC. by_vars argument specified list data.frames one data.frame strata returned.

title: Summary Table — summary_table
text: Creates stratified summary table rates.

title: Summary Table — summary_table
code: summary_table(   data,   vars,   strata = NULL,   overall = FALSE,   get_rates = FALSE,   event = NULL,   st = NULL,   control = list(ctype = "inc.rate", method = "exact") )

title: Summary Table — summary_table
text: data data.frame includes data summarised. vars character vector specifying variables summarised. summary_table can summarise variables class numeric factor. strata optional character vector specifying variables summary table stratified . overall TRUE additionall summary table created including complete dataset. can used combination strata. get_rates TRUE summary tables includes events rates events specified event argument level variables var. Rates can estimated factor variables var. event Name event indicator used compute rates. Needs specified get_rates == TRUE. st Name varaible includes survival time used comptue rates. Needs specified get_rates == TRUE. control list control parameters passed epiR::epi.conf() call estimating confidence intervals rates. can used change type method used estimating confidence intervals. Check documentation epiR::epi.conf() information.

title: Summary Table — summary_table
text: data.table following columns: varname: Including name variable name category factor variables mean: mean variable, .e. proportion binary variables p25: 25th percentile (metric variables.) p75: 75th percentile (metric varaibles.) min: Minimum variable max: Maximum variable n_category: number non-NA observations variable cateogry n_total: number non-NA observations variable n_NA: number NA observations variable category strata variables supplied summary_table output data.table include one row strata variable corresponding value specific strata row belongs .
